required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Oral LY317615 in Relapsed or Refractory Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphomas.
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2 Evaluation of Oral LY317615 in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: This study will measure the effectiveness and any side effects of LY317615 in participants with diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL: a sub-type of Non-Hodgkins Lymphoma).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Relapsed or Refractory DLBCL Who Are Progression-Free for at Least 2 Cycles (28-Day Cycles) After Receiving Enzastaurin (LY317615) (Clinical Response Rate)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to measured progressive disease (PD) up to 34.3 months
primary_outcome.description: Clinical Response Rate in participants with DLBCL was calculated as (number of participants who were progression-free for at least two 28-day cycles [clinical responder]) divided by (total number of participants analyzed) multiplied by 100. Progression free survival (PFS) defined as the time from randomization to the first observation of disease progression or death due to any cause. Progression is defined using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v 1.0) as 20% increase in the sum of the of the longest diameter of target lesions, or a measurable increase in a non-target lesion, or the appearance of new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) (Overall Response Rate)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to measured PD or death up to 34.3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Overall response rate was defined as best study response (CR or PR) using modified Southwest Oncology Group (SWOG) Response criteria. CR defined as the disappearance of detectable clinical and radiographic evidence of disease; regression of lymph nodes, nodal masses and spleen to normal size and absence of lymphoma in bone marrow infiltrate. PR was defined as a ≥50% decrease in the sum of the products of their diameters (SPD) in the 6 largest dominant nodes or nodal masses; no increase in size in the other nodes or liver or spleen; regression of nodes/lesions in organs by ≥50% in the SPD; or no new disease sites. The percentage participants was calculated as: (number of participants with CR or PR) divided by (number of participants qualified for tumor response analysis) multiplied by 100.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to PD or death due to any cause up to 34.3 months
secondary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time from randomization to the first observation of disease progression or death due to any cause. For participants not known to have died as of the data cut-off date and who did not have PD, PFS was censored at the date of last follow-up visit. Progression is determined using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v 1.0) as 20% increase in the sum of the of the longest diameter of target lesions, or a measurable increase in a non-target lesion, or the appearance of new lesions.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time of response to PD up to 34.3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of CR or PR was defined as the time from first objective assessment to first time of disease progression or death from any cause using the modified SWOG Response criteria. CR defined as the disappearance of detectable clinical and radiographic evidence of disease, regression of lymph nodes, nodal masses and spleen to normal size and absence of lymphoma in bone marrow infiltrate. PR was defined as a ≥50% decrease in the SPD in the 6 largest dominant nodes or nodal masses, no increase in size in the other nodes, liver or spleen, regression of nodes/lesions in organs by ≥50% in the SPD, and no new disease sites. PD defined as >50% increase in SPD of the dominant nodal/non-nodal sites or new lesions. For participants who died, the duration of response was censored at death. For participants still alive, duration of overall response was censored at the last visit or follow-up visit. DOR was not analyzed due to low number of responders (CR or PR).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) or Who Died
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to study completion [Baseline up to 37 cycles (28-day cycles, 34.3 months) and 30-day follow-up]
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically significant events were defined as serious AEs (SAEs) and other non-serious AEs. Participants who died due to PD, AEs while on treatment or died during the 30-day post-treatment period are included. A summary of SAEs and other non-serious AEs regardless of causality is located in the Reported Adverse Events module.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Area Under the Concentration Time Curve at Steady State for One Dosing Interval (AUC0-24,ss) of Enzastaurin and Its Metabolite LY326020
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1 predose, 1 to 4 hours postdose and Cycle 1 Day 28 predose and at least 1-hour postdose (28-day cycle)
secondary_outcome.description: AUC0-24,ss during 1 dosing interval at steady state for Enzastaurin and its metabolite LY326020.

secondary_outcome.measure: PKCβ Expression by IHC in Readily Assessable DLBCL Tumors From Participants
secondary_outcome.description: Protein expression was measured (cytoplasmic staining) using an IHC assay from a small subset of tumor tissue samples that were scored using a 0 (negative, no staining) to 3+ (brightest staining) scoring system, where higher staining indicated a greater PKCβ expression.

arm_group.description: 500 milligrams (mg), oral, daily (QD), up to six (6) 28-day cycles

intervention.description: 500 mg, oral, QD, up to six 28 day cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A diagnosis of recurrent or refractory DLBCL.
- Adequate organ functions.
- Able to swallow capsules.
Exclusion Criteria:
- More than 3 prior treatments for this disease.
- Serious heart problems.

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

facility.name: For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon-Fri from 9AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.

For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon-Fri from 9AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.

For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon-Fri from 9AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participant Flow is reporting participants who discontinued from study drug. Per the protocol, a participant completed the study if the planned duration of treatment (6 cycles) was completed in the absence of disease progression or other reasons for discontinuation.

group.title: Enzastaurin
group.description: 500 milligrams (mg) enzastaurin (LY317615) tablets were administered in the morning within 30 minutes following a meal for 28 days (1 cycle) to be continued for up to 6 cycles in the absence of disease progression.

milestone.title: Received at Least 1 Dose of Study Drug
Completed at Least 1 Cycle of Study Drug

baseline.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.title: Enzastaurin
group.description: 500 mg enzastaurin (LY317615) tablets were administered in the morning within 30 minutes following a meal for 28 days (1 cycle) to be continued for up to 6 cycles in the absence of disease progression.

measure.title: PKCβ expression by IHC in DLBCL Tumors
measure.description: Protein Kinase C Beta (PKCβ) and Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma (DLBCL). Protein expression was measured using an Immunohistochemistry (IHC) assay from tumor tissue samples that were scored using a 0 (negative, no staining) to 3+ (brightest staining) scoring system for cytoplasmic and nuclear staining. Three (3) participants had diagnostic tissue samples available for assay.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Relapsed or Refractory DLBCL Who Are Progression-Free for at Least 2 Cycles (28-Day Cycles) After Receiving Enzastaurin (LY317615) (Clinical Response Rate)
outcome.description: Clinical Response Rate in participants with DLBCL was calculated as (number of participants who were progression-free for at least two 28-day cycles [clinical responder]) divided by (total number of participants analyzed) multiplied by 100. Progression free survival (PFS) defined as the time from randomization to the first observation of disease progression or death due to any cause. Progression is defined using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v 1.0) as 20% increase in the sum of the of the longest diameter of target lesions, or a measurable increase in a non-target lesion, or the appearance of new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Randomization to measured progressive disease (PD) up to 34.3 months
outcome.population: All randomized participants who remained on study for at least 1 cycle of treatment.

group.title: Enzastaurin
group.description: 500 mg enzastaurin (LY317615) tablets were administered in the morning within 30 minutes following a meal for 28 days (1 cycle) to be continued for up to 6 cycles in the absence of disease progression.

measure.description: Clinical Response Rate in participants with DLBCL was calculated as (number of participants who were progression-free for at least two 28-day cycles [clinical responder]) divided by (total number of participants analyzed) multiplied by 100. Progression free survival (PFS) defined as the time from randomization to the first observation of disease progression or death due to any cause. Progression is defined using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v 1.0) as 20% increase in the sum of the of the longest diameter of target lesions, or a measurable increase in a non-target lesion, or the appearance of new lesions.
measure.population: All randomized participants who remained on study for at least 1 cycle of treatment.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) (Overall Response Rate)
outcome.description: Overall response rate was defined as best study response (CR or PR) using modified Southwest Oncology Group (SWOG) Response criteria. CR defined as the disappearance of detectable clinical and radiographic evidence of disease; regression of lymph nodes, nodal masses and spleen to normal size and absence of lymphoma in bone marrow infiltrate. PR was defined as a ≥50% decrease in the sum of the products of their diameters (SPD) in the 6 largest dominant nodes or nodal masses; no increase in size in the other nodes or liver or spleen; regression of nodes/lesions in organs by ≥50% in the SPD; or no new disease sites. The percentage participants was calculated as: (number of participants with CR or PR) divided by (number of participants qualified for tumor response analysis) multiplied by 100.
outcome.time_frame: Randomization to measured PD or death up to 34.3 months
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.title: Enzastaurin
group.description: 500 mg enzastaurin (LY317615) tablets were administered in the morning within 30 minutes following a meal for 28 days (1 cycle) to be continued for up to 6 cycles in the absence of disease progression.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) (Overall Response Rate)
measure.description: Overall response rate was defined as best study response (CR or PR) using modified Southwest Oncology Group (SWOG) Response criteria. CR defined as the disappearance of detectable clinical and radiographic evidence of disease; regression of lymph nodes, nodal masses and spleen to normal size and absence of lymphoma in bone marrow infiltrate. PR was defined as a ≥50% decrease in the sum of the products of their diameters (SPD) in the 6 largest dominant nodes or nodal masses; no increase in size in the other nodes or liver or spleen; regression of nodes/lesions in organs by ≥50% in the SPD; or no new disease sites. The percentage participants was calculated as: (number of participants with CR or PR) divided by (number of participants qualified for tumor response analysis) multiplied by 100.
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS)
outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time from randomization to the first observation of disease progression or death due to any cause. For participants not known to have died as of the data cut-off date and who did not have PD, PFS was censored at the date of last follow-up visit. Progression is determined using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v 1.0) as 20% increase in the sum of the of the longest diameter of target lesions, or a measurable increase in a non-target lesion, or the appearance of new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Randomization to PD or death due to any cause up to 34.3 months
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. Five (5) participants were censored.

group.title: Enzastaurin
group.description: 500 mg enzastaurin (LY317615) tablets were administered in the morning within 30 minutes following a meal for 28 days (1 cycle) to be continued for up to 6 cycles in the absence of disease progression.

measure.title: Progression Free Survival (PFS)
measure.description: PFS was defined as the time from randomization to the first observation of disease progression or death due to any cause. For participants not known to have died as of the data cut-off date and who did not have PD, PFS was censored at the date of last follow-up visit. Progression is determined using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v 1.0) as 20% increase in the sum of the of the longest diameter of target lesions, or a measurable increase in a non-target lesion, or the appearance of new lesions.
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug. Five (5) participants were censored.

outcome.title: Duration of Overall Response (DOR)
outcome.description: Duration of CR or PR was defined as the time from first objective assessment to first time of disease progression or death from any cause using the modified SWOG Response criteria. CR defined as the disappearance of detectable clinical and radiographic evidence of disease, regression of lymph nodes, nodal masses and spleen to normal size and absence of lymphoma in bone marrow infiltrate. PR was defined as a ≥50% decrease in the SPD in the 6 largest dominant nodes or nodal masses, no increase in size in the other nodes, liver or spleen, regression of nodes/lesions in organs by ≥50% in the SPD, and no new disease sites. PD defined as >50% increase in SPD of the dominant nodal/non-nodal sites or new lesions. For participants who died, the duration of response was censored at death. For participants still alive, duration of overall response was censored at the last visit or follow-up visit. DOR was not analyzed due to low number of responders (CR or PR).
outcome.time_frame: Time of response to PD up to 34.3 months

group.title: Enzastaurin
group.description: 500 mg enzastaurin (LY317615) tablets were administered in the morning within 30 minutes following a meal for 28 days (1 cycle) to be continued for up to 6 cycles in the absence of disease progression.

measure.title: Duration of Overall Response (DOR)
measure.description: Duration of CR or PR was defined as the time from first objective assessment to first time of disease progression or death from any cause using the modified SWOG Response criteria. CR defined as the disappearance of detectable clinical and radiographic evidence of disease, regression of lymph nodes, nodal masses and spleen to normal size and absence of lymphoma in bone marrow infiltrate. PR was defined as a ≥50% decrease in the SPD in the 6 largest dominant nodes or nodal masses, no increase in size in the other nodes, liver or spleen, regression of nodes/lesions in organs by ≥50% in the SPD, and no new disease sites. PD defined as >50% increase in SPD of the dominant nodal/non-nodal sites or new lesions. For participants who died, the duration of response was censored at death. For participants still alive, duration of overall response was censored at the last visit or follow-up visit. DOR was not analyzed due to low number of responders (CR or PR).

measurement_list.measurement: Insufficient number of participants with events

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) or Who Died
outcome.description: Clinically significant events were defined as serious AEs (SAEs) and other non-serious AEs. Participants who died due to PD, AEs while on treatment or died during the 30-day post-treatment period are included. A summary of SAEs and other non-serious AEs regardless of causality is located in the Reported Adverse Events module.
outcome.time_frame: Randomization to study completion [Baseline up to 37 cycles (28-day cycles, 34.3 months) and 30-day follow-up]
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.title: Enzastaurin
group.description: 500 mg enzastaurin (LY317615) was administered orally at dose in the morning within 30 minutes following a meal for 28 days (1 cycle) to be continued for up to 6 cycles in the absence of disease progression.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) or Who Died
measure.description: Clinically significant events were defined as serious AEs (SAEs) and other non-serious AEs. Participants who died due to PD, AEs while on treatment or died during the 30-day post-treatment period are included. A summary of SAEs and other non-serious AEs regardless of causality is located in the Reported Adverse Events module.
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Area Under the Concentration Time Curve at Steady State for One Dosing Interval (AUC0-24,ss) of Enzastaurin and Its Metabolite LY326020
outcome.description: AUC0-24,ss during 1 dosing interval at steady state for Enzastaurin and its metabolite LY326020.
outcome.time_frame: Cycle 1 Day 1 predose, 1 to 4 hours postdose and Cycle 1 Day 28 predose and at least 1-hour postdose (28-day cycle)
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had evaluable PK data to calculate AUC0-24,ss.

group.title: Enzastaurin
group.description: 500 mg enzastaurin (LY317615) tablets were administered in the morning within 30 minutes following a meal for 28 days (1 cycle) to be continued for up to 6 cycles in the absence of disease progression.

measure.title: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Area Under the Concentration Time Curve at Steady State for One Dosing Interval (AUC0-24,ss) of Enzastaurin and Its Metabolite LY326020
measure.description: AUC0-24,ss during 1 dosing interval at steady state for Enzastaurin and its metabolite LY326020.
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug and had evaluable PK data to calculate AUC0-24,ss.

outcome.title: PKCβ Expression by IHC in Readily Assessable DLBCL Tumors From Participants
outcome.description: Protein expression was measured (cytoplasmic staining) using an IHC assay from a small subset of tumor tissue samples that were scored using a 0 (negative, no staining) to 3+ (brightest staining) scoring system, where higher staining indicated a greater PKCβ expression.
outcome.population: Participants who had paired diagnositic and relapsed tumor assessed for PKCβ expression.

group.title: Enzastaurin
group.description: 500 mg enzastaurin (LY317615) tablets were administered in the morning within 30 minutes following a meal for 28 days (1 cycle) to be continued for up to 6 cycles in the absence of disease progression.

measure.title: PKCβ Expression by IHC in Readily Assessable DLBCL Tumors From Participants
measure.description: Protein expression was measured (cytoplasmic staining) using an IHC assay from a small subset of tumor tissue samples that were scored using a 0 (negative, no staining) to 3+ (brightest staining) scoring system, where higher staining indicated a greater PKCβ expression.
measure.population: Participants who had paired diagnositic and relapsed tumor assessed for PKCβ expression.

class.title: 3+ and 0 at Diagnosis and 3+ at Relapse

reported_events.desc: Study-specific clinical outcomes due to PD were not considered to be a SAE unless the investigator deemed it related to the use of the study drug.

group.title: Enzastaurin
group.description: 500 mg enzastaurin tablets were administered in the morning within 30 minutes of a meal for 28 days (1 cycle) to be continued for up to 6 cycles in the absence of disease progression.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
